title: The physics of the "hardest move" in ballet
description: In the third act of "Swan Lake", the Black Swan pulls off a seemingly endless series of turns, bobbing up and down on one pointed foot and spinning around and around and around ... thirty-two times. How is this move — which is called a fouetté — even possible? Arleen Sugano unravels the physics of this famous ballet move.
author: Arleen Sugano
keywords: TED, talks, TED-Ed, dance, physics, science and art, science, sports
